synopsis_with_character_names: The episode begins with a meeting in the back of Satriale's. Paulie and Silvio sit outside to guard while Tony, Junior, Palmice, Barese, Curto, and Altieri meet. Junior states that they have all figured everything out in case the indictments occur. Junior asks Altieri if all of his concerns were answered. Altieri states that a lot of ground was covered and he's satisfied. The meeting is adjourned. After the rest of the captains leave, Junior and Palmice stop Tony. Junior states that he has no doubt that Altieri is the rat. Tony agrees and notes that they had a meeting about things that they already discussed. Tony knows that Altieri is wearing a wire. Junior tells Tony he is giving him approval to take out a hit on Altieri and adds that Tony needs to send a message to everyone else about it. Tony thanks Junior and Palmice and they part. When Junior and Palmice leave, Tony smirks after them. Later that night, Christopher takes Altieri to a hotel. The two have a conversation about the different types of girls that they like. Altieri notes that he heard Christopher hated Russian girls. Christopher states he was just bitter about one that used to hang out with Junior, but Tony's mistress, Irina, is very fine. Christopher states that the girls they are seeing tonight are friends of Irina's. Altieri asks Christopher if he has enough cologne on. Christopher states that he is wearing enough. Altieri states that Christopher has the advantage since he's younger. Christopher promises Altieri that he'll be happy after tonight. The men arrive at the hotel room and knock on the door. One of the girls comes outside into the hallway. She looks at Altieri in a seductive way and heads over to the next room to get the other girl. Altieri is really excited and heads into the room with Christopher. Christopher offers Altieri a seat and Altieri sits down. When he does, Silvio bursts into the room. Altieri tries to draw his weapon, but Christopher is able to stop him from drawing. Silvio aims a silenced pistol at Altieri's head. Altieri curses at the men and asks them if they are aware he is a captain. Silvio suggests to Altieri that he call for help on his FBI wire. Altieri realizes that they've found out he's a rat. Silvio realizes that Altieri probably isn't wearing a wire tonight. Christopher adds that Altieri didn't have time to put anything decent on. Altieri mutters forgiveness to God and Silvio shoots him. Blood spatter and brain matter hit the table and lamp in front of him and Altieri falls to the floor dead. At the Soprano residence, Meadow and her boyfriend are having a romantic night while watching a scary movie. The boyfriend stops for a moment and tells Meadow he thinks that someone is at her back gate. Meadow turns off the television and listens to see if she hears something. Outside, someone is heard calling the name, Settimia. The two freak out and wonder what is going on. Meadow sees Livia outside and wonders how she got out of Green Grove. AJ hears the noise from upstairs as well and gets some clothes on. Livia shouts outside and yells for Cakey to go get Settimia. AJ shouts down to Livia and says it's only him. Livia states that Cakey sounds like he has whooping cough and tells AJ to get under the vaporizer. Meadow runs to the back door to let Livia in. Livia still thinks Meadow is Settimia and she tells her that she is never speaking to her again. Meadow tries to calm down Livia and tells her that Settimia is dead and she is Meadow. Livia seems to become her old self again and remembers Meadow. She tells Meadow that she can't stay in the house after all that's happened. The doorbell rings and AJ answers the door. A police officer comes into the home. Livia asks the police officer to take Settimia out of her house. The officer notes that it is one in the morning and asks Livia why she's walking out alone this late at night. Livia tells him to shut up. The police officer tells Meadow that they got some complaints from the neighbors. Meadow tells the officer that Livia is their grandmother. The officer asks Livia if she knows these children. Livia says that she knows Meadow and AJ are her grandchildren. The next day at therapy, Dr. Melfi asks Tony about Livia coming to the house last night. Tony tells Dr. Melfi that she thought she was going to see her sister, Settimia. Tony tells Dr. Melfi that Livia is getting tested for Alzheimer's disease. Dr. Melfi notes that it's been a long odyssey with Livia. Tony agrees that things have been difficult. Tony is upset and tells Dr. Melfi that Green Grove is transferring Livia to the nursing unit in the home which she dreaded all along. Dr. Melfi notes that it's interesting that her memory loss started after he was almost killed. Dr. Melfi asks Tony if he really thinks it was a carjacking. Tony admits to her that he knows it wasn't a carjacking and he thinks that he knows who was behind everything. He says that he isn't going to go there with the conversation. Dr. Melfi thinks that Tony is overall reluctant to even confront the situation. She notes that around the time of the shooting he was having hallucinations of Isabella who was seen as a protective and loving mother. Dr. Melfi believes that Tony's subconscious was telling him something. Dr. Melfi notes that before the shooting Tony had mentioned Livia talking about news stories of mothers that were throwing their babies out windows. Tony is getting really agitated and tells Dr. Melfi to stop talking indirectly. Tony asks Dr. Melfi if she is really trying to tell him that Livia tried to have him murdered because of the fact he put Livia in a nursing home. Dr. Melfi notes that Tony also had the dream where the duck flew away with his penis. Tony notes Livia never threatened to do anything like that to him. Dr. Melfi tells Tony that most patients find their own ways of breaking through their issues, but since Tony's life is in danger she is willing to put the cards on the table to help him. Dr. Melfi honestly believes that Livia has borderline personality disorder. Tony is doubtful, but Dr. Melfi reads it from her book. The book says that borderline personality disorder involves unstable relationships, affective instability, intense anxiety, and joylessness. Dr. Melfi further adds that the phobias and paranoia are the only things that seem real while the real world and real people are peripheral and have no love or compassion for others. Livia is known to create bitterness and conflict amongst members of their family and that encompasses borderline personality disorder. Tony throws the glass table across the room and shatters. Tony gets straight into Dr. Melfi's face and curses at her. He states that they are talking about his mother and that is not a light subject. He tells Dr. Melfi that he is done with therapy and doesn't want to meet with her any longer. He notes that she is lucky he doesn't give her a good beating before he leaves. Tony leaves the office. Dr. Melfi locks her door and puts a chair in front of it so Tony can't get back inside. At Vesuvio, Rosalie tells Carmela that Aprile's work in the Mafia was what killed him because the stress caused the cancer. Carmela notes that when Aprile was the boss everything was peaceful and Tony's attempted assassination put an end to that peace. Rosalie notes that it's hard to say how Aprile would have ended up if he had lived longer. Rosalie notes that Angie Bonpensiero has been a shell since Pussy disappeared. Artie comes out and serves the women some food. Carmela notes that with the way Artie is serving them food they will walk out of the restaurant as hippos. Rosalie honestly tells Artie she thinks that the new restaurant is better than the old Vesuvio was. Artie says that there are just a few things that need to be worked out with the new restaurant and then it will be ready to run. Artie is happy that he got the insurance money for the restaurant. Artie asks Carmela about Livia. Carmela tells Artie that the doctors think Livia is displaying signs of Alzheimer's. Artie is sad to hear that and notes that he's known Livia since he was little. He notes that Tony is probably a wreck and Carmela tells him that Tony is beside himself at this point. Artie notes that Tony has a lot on his plate right now and leaves the women so they can eat. Artie goes back into the kitchen to find Charmaine preparing food. Artie asks her why she's hiding in the kitchen and notes that Carmela and Rosalie are sitting outside. Artie asks Charmaine when she is going to be willing to bury the hatchet. Charmaine tells Artie that Carmela is like a sister to her, but that she doesn't want the new Vesuvio to be another hangout for the Mafia. Artie notes that publicity like that is good for the restaurant, but Charmaine disagrees saying that is publicity they need to avoid. Back in the dining room, Father Intintola has joined the women at their table. Rosalie is glad that Father Intintola was able to make it to the restaurant and notes to him that the food is great. Father Intintola feels that something special is going on if the women were invited to the restaurant before the grand opening. Father Intintola tells Rosalie that he was over at Carmela's last night making zabaglione with her. Carmela tells Father Intintola he did most of the cooking of the food. Father Intintola wishes that Tony would have allowed him a moment to talk about the carjacking. Carmela agrees with him. Father Intintola tells the ladies that he has to return to his table to order some food. Carmela tells Father Intintola to sit with them. Rosalie agrees and asks Father Intintola how the watch is. Father Intintola tells her that the watch works perfectly and thanks her. Carmela looks at the watch and asks Rosalie if it was Aprile's watch. Rosalie says that it is and she softly sobs in remembrance of Aprile. Father Intintola holds Rosalie's hand, softly stroking it. Carmela takes notice to this gesture. Later that night, a man walks down an alley after buying several cases of beer. He suddenly trips and spills everything on the ground. When he gets up, he sees Altieri's dead body with a rat stuffed in his mouth. In an undisclosed location, Agent Harris leads Tony into a room with several FBI agents. Agent Harris tells them that Tony came willingly. Tony states he only came because Agent Harris threatened to wait until Meadow and AJ got home. Tony arrives downstairs to see Agent Grasso and Chief Frank Cubitoso. Tony takes a seat in a chair. Chief Cubitoso notes to Tony that they are all aware that there was an attempt on his life a few days ago. They know that Tony has enemies and he may be through with holding any type of power in New Jersey. Tony tells Chief Cubitoso that he already had this conversation with Agent Harris and once again states that he is not going to help them. Chief Cubitoso shows Tony a tape with a recording on it, but Tony still has no interest in anything. Chief Cubitoso tells Tony that he and Agent Grasso had a colloquy about their shared Italian heritage. Chief Cubitoso says that they all come from different parts of Italy, but they all share common cultural ideas. Chief Cubitoso says there might be a chance Tony will change his mind about testifying. Tony tells Chief Cubitoso to get to the point. Chief Cubitoso plays the tape where Junior and Livia had a conversation about the hit on Tony. In the conversation, Junior alludes to the fact that Tony had her put in a nursing home and Livia tells Junior that Tony is seeing a psychiatrist and she only wonders what he tells them. Tony realizes the FBI wired Green Grove. Chief Cubitoso takes credit for this and notes everyone else thought it was a waste of time. Chief Cubitoso fast forwards through parts of the tape and starts to play it again at the part when Livia tells Junior about Cakey after his lobotomy looked like Tony and it was better that Cakey died than live in a lobotomized state. Tony continues to listen as Livia tells Junior that Altieri, Barese, and Curto all met in Green Grove after their mother moved in. Tony then hears Junior making the statement that he has to kill Tony. Tony has a lot to take in. At the nursing unit, Artie visits Livia in her room. Artie asks Livia if she remembers who he is. Livia says that she does remember Artie and mistakenly says that he and John played baseball together. Artie corrects her and says that he played baseball with Tony. Livia tells Artie that she remembers now and asks him what is wrong with her. She asks Artie how he's doing. Artie tells her that he's doing great. Livia asks Artie how his mother is doing and asks if he calls her every day. Artie reminds Livia that his mother passed away almost six months ago. Artie tells Livia he brought her something from Vesuvio. Livia says she does remember Vesuvio and remembers that Artie's father used to be the owner. Artie says that she is right and tells her that he has a new restaurant now. Artie has brought Livia some Cavatelli. Livia doesn't seem happy about it. Artie asks Livia what is wrong. Livia tells Artie that he is a good man for coming to visit her. She tells him that after what Tony did to him she doesn't see how she can look Artie in the face. Artie asks Livia what Tony did. Livia tells him that she doesn't see how he can't blame Tony for setting fire to Vesuvio. Artie is taken aback by this news. Livia says that Artie is a good man if he can forgive Tony for that and notes that they are lucky that nobody was killed in the fire. At the Bada Bing, Paulie and Christopher are hanging out in the backroom. Paulie tells Christopher that Altieri's wake is tonight. Christopher tells Paulie it will be ruined because he phoned in a bomb scare. Silvio thinks Christopher may have went a little over the top with that. Tony comes into the room and the three are at attention when he does. Tony tells the men that it was Junior and Palmice that took out the hit against him. Christopher notes that this shouldn't be surprising news. Paulie asks Tony how he knows for sure. Tony says that there is no room for interpretation for that question. Silvio can't believe Junior would kill his own nephew. Tony tells the men that they need to plan things out and make no mistakes. Paulie thinks that Junior is going to try and figure out how to finish Tony off first. Christopher adds that this time Junior won't just give out the hit to a couple of gangsters. Silvio states that Junior might give the hit to Signore because Palmice has been given a huge promotion so he won't just be a hitman. Tony states that Signore has to disappear without anyone knowing. Tony states he just passed his Coast Guard test, which means he knows what he's going to do. Paulie asks Tony if there is anything else. Tony tells them that his ear hurts. At the Soprano residence, Carmela gives Tony a sleeping pill so he can actually get some rest tonight. Tony asks Carmela what kind of a person he is if his own mother wants him killed. Carmela tells Tony that the problem doesn't lie with Tony, but with Livia. She says that everyone knows Livia has always been a different sort of breed. Tony states that it isn't the point. Carmela reminds Tony that over the years, Livia's condition has steadily become worse. Carmela is surprised that there aren't any contracts on Tony's sisters for abandoning Livia. Carmela tells Tony that he is the better person for trying to make Livia's relationship with the family work. Tony says that after two men with nine millimeter pistols tried to kill him, his self-esteem was drained. Carmela says that she could kill Livia with her own hands at this point. Tony tells Carmela that she needs to play the card of the concerned daughter-in-law and not let Livia suspect anything. Carmela tells Tony that she isn't concerned about business at this point and even states she thinks Livia's Alzheimer's is an act so she can't be held responsible. Tony knows that he and Junior have had their problems with business, but he thinks Junior is also angry at Tony because he made fun of him for his great performance of oral sex. He says that oral sex and psychiatry caused this war. Carmela tells Tony he had to see the psychiatrist because of Livia. Tony says that when he sees the guys all he can feel is humiliation. Tony tells Carmela he is going to take care of Junior and Palmice and from that he'll get satisfaction. The next day, Tony parks his car along the shore. Silvio opens the trunk and gets out a huge fish. Tony walks down the boardwalk and sees Chucky Signore in his new boat. Signore is startled to see Tony and asks him what he's doing here. Tony tells Signore he is here to take his new boat, the Stugots, out onto the river. Tony is holding the large fish in his hand and tells Signore to look at how great the fish is. Tony reaches into the mouth of the fish and pulls out a gun. He shoots Signore until the clip is empty. Signore's dead body falls into the boat. Silvio pulls out some chains and cinderblocks from the trunk of the car. Tony and Silvio get into the boat and drive it out onto the river. Dr. Melfi is about to leave her office when Tony arrives. When Dr. Melfi sees him, she shuts the door and locks him out. Tony pleads with her to open the door because he needs to talk to her. Dr. Melfi is too frightened by the events that happened earlier in the day for her to listen to him. Dr. Melfi tells Tony she is calling the police because he has given her no other option but to do so. Tony again asks her to open up. Dr. Melfi dials the police and tells Tony that if anything happens to her the police will hear it on the other end of the phone. Tony says that they can go down to the coffee shop to talk if she is more comfortable with that. Dr. Melfi asks Tony if she has his word that he will not harm her physically. Tony says that she has his word nothing will happen to her. Dr. Melfi hangs up the phone. She takes a pair of scissors and puts them under the sleeve of her outfit. She turns on the lights and unlocks the door. Dr. Melfi sits behind her desk and Tony sits on the other end. Dr. Melfi tells Tony that she isn't happy that she was right about Livia. She asks Tony if he's had any dreams since he heard the FBI tapes. Tony says he has had some sex dreams involving Jeanie Cusamano. Tony says that he is making love with Jeanie Cusamano in his dreams, but he can never see her face. Dr. Melfi thinks that this might be feelings of worthlessness over the fact that Livia tried to have him killed. Tony tells them that one of the reasons that he was almost killed was because he was seeing her for therapy. Dr. Melfi tells Tony that their conversations are privileged and she can't be compelled to testify against anyone. Tony says that his enemies might know that, but they might not. Dr. Melfi notes that she doesn't even know any of Tony's associates because he never mentioned them by name. Tony tells Dr. Melfi that he feels she is danger. Dr. Melfi doesn't think that is a fair assessment at all. Tony tells Dr. Melfi that nobody cares about fair in his line of work. Dr. Melfi asks Tony what she's supposed to do about that. Tony tells her that she needs to get out of town tonight. Dr. Melfi states that she can't just leave on short notice. She states that she has a life and patients to tend to. She notes that some of her patients are fragile and could commit suicide while she's away. Tony states that if Dr. Melfi is killed then it won't change the difference of their outcomes. Tony tells Dr. Melfi that he is sorry about all of this and assures her that he is going to take care of the problem and then she can come back. Dr. Melfi knows that people are going to be killed. Tony tells her not to worry about that and tells her instead to take care of herself. Tony adds that the police aren't going to give her anything because she can't give them any information. Tony tells her again that she needs to leave town. He tells her that she has been a good doctor to him and he appreciates that. He leaves the office. Tony arrives at Satriale's to find Artie in the parking lot. Artie has a rifle in his hands and he aims it at Tony. Tony asks Artie what is going on. Artie asks Tony how he could have done what he did. Tony thinks that Junior hired Artie to kill him and tells him to just pull the trigger because he doesn't care anymore. Artie tells Tony that the restaurant was like his child and three generations of his family worked over the same stoves. Artie tells Tony that even Livia cherishes all of her memories at Vesuvio. Artie tells Tony not to say that Livia is lying because there is no reason for Livia to do that. Tony asks Artie what Livia told him. Artie asks Tony that he not treat him like he's stupid. He is angry because when Tony set fire to Vesuvio he made Artie part of a criminal conspiracy. Tony states to Artie that he doesn't know what Livia told him, but he says that they do know that two arson investigators stated that the fire was an accident. Tony asks Artie why he would even blow up Vesuvio. Artie yells that he believes that it was because Tony thought in a twisted way that blowing up the restaurant would stop a hit that Junior was going to stage in Vesuvio. Artie asks Tony what kind of sick logic that is. Tony asks Artie to think about it and ask him if he's stupid enough to do that. Tony tells Artie that Livia is going senile and even Artie can see that. Artie sobs and says that he does love his new restaurant a lot, but it'll never be Vesuvio. Tony swears to God that he never burnt down Vesuvio. Artie tells Tony to look him in the eye and swear it to him again. Tony again swears to Artie that he didn't burn down Vesuvio and he swears on Livia. Artie lowers the rifle and then smashes it to pieces against his car. He gets in and peels out of the lot. At the Soprano residence, Junior and Livia once again join the family for a meal. Tony states that it's nice that they all are able to eat a Sunday dinner together. Nobody else is really talking. Carmela breaks the silence and tells Livia that the nursing unit is good if they let the patients out for family occasions. Livia says that she doesn't have anything to admit. Meadow tells everyone she needs to leave in ten minutes to study with Hunter. Livia asks them if the pork is cooked. Tony recognizes that Meadow is going to be on her own soon and AJ will follow a few years after. Livia tells everyone that last week in the paper she read about a family in Saint Luis Obispo that died of trichinosis which can be found in uncooked pork. Tony notes that the article was in the paper last year. Livia mocks that Tony knows everything. Tony asks Junior about the indictments. Junior says that his lawyer told him that the indictment hasn't been released yet. Carmela asks Livia if she agrees that business should not be discussed at the table. Livia doesn't say anything. Tony asks Livia if Artie came by to see her the other day. Livia asks Tony who Artie is. Tony reminds Livia that Artie is a friend of his from elementary school that owns a restaurant. Livia says that she doesn't remember seeing anyone named Artie and asks if he's talking about visiting in the house or elsewhere. Tony and Junior look at Livia, both of them knowing that Livia is putting on an act. At the church, Artie visits Father Intintola and tells him that he's lost his belief in everything. Father Intintola notes that Artie moved away from God some time ago. Father Intintola asks if it's fair to say that recent events were not the cause of his move from God. Artie says it is fair to say that. He tells Father Intintola that every time he comes to church his mind begins to wander. He says he can only stare at the stained glass and he's full of rage. He tells Father Intintola that he doesn't just hate Tony, but all men and life. Father Intintola asks Artie if he tried to talk to Charmaine about this. Artie states that he can't do that because it would ruin her. Father Intintola states that Charmaine is a strong woman and she will find out one way or the other. Artie says he didn't go to the insurance when the restaurant was burned down. He says that legally he could have been hit with a defamation suit. Father Intintola tells Artie that his heart is telling him the answer. He knows that Artie hasn't told Charmaine because she is going to tell him to go to the police and this will jeopardize his new restaurant. Father Intintola tells Artie that he needs to stay strong. Artie tells Father Intintola that he is getting off of the important subject. At Satriale's, Christopher arrives late to a meeting where Paulie, Silvio, and Tony are waiting. Tony tells the men that he has something to tell them and he wanted them to hear it from him. Tony takes a deep breath and tells them that for the last five months he's been seeing a psychiatrist because of his panic attacks. The men stay silent for several moments and Tony asks them to all speak their minds. Silvio tells Tony that he trusts that he did this with complete discretion. Silvio also speaks on behalf of Pussy and notes that Pussy would feel the same way. Tony assures them he never spoke of business and the psychiatrist doesn't know anyone's names. Tony adds Junior knows that he is seeing a psychiatrist and is using that as a reason for the war. Tony tells them that if there is anything they want to see they need to say it now because this discussion is not happening again. Paulie tells Tony he's heard worse things in life and he was seeing a therapist a year ago. The men are surprised by this. Paulie states he had issues and has since resolved them. Silvio says that their business is struggling and he thinks it would be appropriate for them to discuss their painful and stressful times, but he knows that will never happen. Tony asks Christopher how he is feeling about this. Christopher asks Tony if it's like marriage counseling. Tony says it's similar. Christopher gets up and leaves the room. Carmela arrives at the church to visit Father Intintola. When she gets there, she finds Father Intintola sitting with Rosalie in his study. He is eating some of her baked ziti and they are discussing food. She sees Rosalie wipe some of the ziti off of his face and the two are smiling and laughing. Carmela is hurt by this scene and she walks outside. She dumps the food she made for Father Intintola into the garbage can and leaves. At Vesuvio, Artie sits down to eat a meal while Charmaine discusses with Adriana a job proposal. Charmaine is pleased with Adriana's abilities and tells her that she's hired. After she leaves, Charmaine sits with Artie and tells him that Adriana catches on to things very fast and is proud of the fact that Adriana wants to be a music manager. Charmaine tells Artie that everything is going well. Artie smiles at her happiness. Charmaine asks Artie what it was he wanted to tell her. Artie tells her that he likes the bar stools and that's what he wanted to tell her. Tony comes downstairs in the morning very happy. Meadow is the first to notice this. At Palmice's house, Palmice yells into the house after JoJo and tells her that if Signore calls the house she needs to call him and tell him. When she doesn't respond, Palmice curses and asks if she heard him. JoJo comes to the door and yells that she heard him the first time. Palmice tells JoJo to go take a Midol. JoJo flips Palmice the middle finger behind his back and slams the door shut. Palmice begins his morning jog. As he runs down a back road, a car begins to slowly follow him. Palmice takes notice to it and he continues to run. He doesn't like the scene and suddenly bolts into the woods. Christopher and Paulie are in the car and they get out to pursue him. Palmice is a fast runner and Christopher and Paulie have to work hard to catch up to him. Christopher fires several shots at him as he runs, but misses. Paulie runs right into a poison ivy patch and curses as he makes his way through. Palmice comes upon a small brook and trips as he tries to cross it. He falls into the water and tries to get up. Christopher catches up to Palmice and puts a bullet in his leg. Palmice falls down in pain and begs Christopher not to kill him. Paulie catches up and complains to Christopher that he got poison ivy all over his face and hands. Christopher tells Palmice that he knows that he shot Filone and never gave him a chance at all. Palmice tries to convince Christopher that it was Junior that shot Filone, not him. Christopher is not stupid and doesn't believe that at all. Paulie complains that the poison ivy is starting to make him itchy already. Against Palmice's pleas, Christopher and Paulie empty their gun magazines into Palmice's body. Palmice's body is riddle with bullets and he lets out one last groan before dying in the brook. Palmice's cell phone begins to ring as Paulie and Christopher leave the murder scene. Later, FBI agents move in to make their arrests in relation to the indictment. Agents are seen going to Junior's house first. Junior looks out the window instead of answering the door, but the FBI see him. They tell him that he is under arrest. Junior realizes the trouble he is in. FBI agents are later seen making arrests at Larry Boy Barese and Joseph "Beppy" Sasso's houses. Tony later watches on the news as Junior, Barese, Sasso, and 13 other members of the Soprano Crime Family were indicted on federal racketeering charges. Tony realizes that the FBI moved in before he was able to take care of Junior and notes that Junior is lucky to be alive. Meadow comes into her parents' room and sees Junior being led away on the television in handcuffs. Tony tells Meadow that he is ashamed that the police are making a decent businessman like Junior do the perpetrator walk. Meadow tells Tony not to act like he feels bad. On the news, U.S. Attorney Gene Conigliaro tells the viewers that the arrests were made after a long investigation of criminal activities that have taken place over the last four years. Conigliaro states that these arrests represent the heaviest blow to Mafia activities in New Jersey since the arrests in the 1980s. AJ comes into the room and Meadow tells him about Junior being arrested. AJ originally thinks that is cool, but Tony gives him a little smack on the back of his head for making that remark. The reports also state that among the people that were not arrested was Mikey Palmice and reports indicate that Palmice may have fled town when he heard about the indictments. JoJo Palmice insists that she knows nothing about Palmice's whereabouts. JoJo appears on the news and tells the reporters that Palmice went out for a jog to try out his new running shoes and he would be back later. JoJo cries and says that Palmice told her that he loved her and left, while we know that is not how Palmice acted when he left the house. Tony smiles to himself knowing the truth that Palmice is dead. The phone rings and one of Tony's government sources is on the phone. Down in the kitchen, Tony tells Carmela that the indictments sound better than they actually are. Tony says the reason he wasn't on the indictment was because the investigation was against Junior and Barese for a calling-card scam they were both working through as well as a Diamante technical stock. Tony says that since he wasn't involved in those activities he wasn't named. Tony does note to Carmela that Altieri did provide the FBI with some information before he was killed and the FBI does have information from his group from the meetings at Green Grove. Carmela realizes that the DA told Tony that there is an ongoing investigation into the Green Grove meetings. Tony says that everyone says that just so the case looks good, but he knows that they need to worry about that later. Tony's concerns are for the men that were arrested today and whether they will turn informant to avoid prosecution. Artie sees Father Intintola at his restaurant. Father Intintola asks him how he's doing. Artie tells him that business is good. Artie tells Father Intintola he wants to thank him for talking to him yesterday. Father Intintola asks Artie if he talked with Charmaine. Artie tells Father Intintola he didn't. He tells Father Intintola that in the church he thought about it and realizes that he can be a yes person or a no person. Father Intintola is confused about what Artie is trying to say. Artie says that Livia was always a negative person and as a kid he would hate to hear her rants. Father Intintola notes that Artie did say Tony was an unstable person. Artie says that he was angry at the time and states that while Tony is confusing and a little comfortable outside of the law he does know that doubting him would add to his sorrow. He says he doesn't see how he can take Livia's word over Tony's. Father Intintola states that Artie seems to be at peace and Artie says that he is. Later, Junior meets with Conigliaro in jail. Conigliaro notes that Junior's tenure as boss was relatively short and unusual in several ways. Conigliaro tells Junior that he is willing to drop all of the charges against him if he testifies that Tony is the boss of the New Jersey Family along with the help of the New York Syndicate in communication with Johnny Sack. Conigliaro tells Junior he wants to arrest Johnny Sack along with associates Mangano and Teresi. Junior retorts he wants a relationship with Angie Dickinson and notes that they will have to see who gets lucky first. Conigliaro asks Junior to corroborate information from informants and wiretaps that he was allowed to profit with Tony as boss, but he wasn't allowed to make policy and was left out of the loop. Conigliaro asks Junior how long he is willing to take the hits for Tony. He notes Junior is 70-years-old and asks him how long he thinks he has. Junior tells Conigliaro that Tony is not running things and as long as he's around, that will never happen. Carmela arrives home to find Father Intintola in the kitchen. Father Intintola takes the shopping bags out of her hands and puts them on the table. Carmela asks Father Intintola how he got inside. Father Intintola tells Carmela that Liliana let him in and then told him she had to leave early. Father Intintola tells Carmela to be careful of the upcoming storm that will hit New Jersey. Carmela asks Father Intintola if he wants coffee. Father Intintola states that if Carmela is making it then he does. Carmela asks Father Intintola not to start that behavior. Father Intintola tells her that it's practically cocktail hour. He asks Carmela how she is doing in lieu of the indictments. Carmela states that they are doing fine. Father Intintola refers back to their discussion a few months ago and asks Carmela if these recent events have compelled Tony to re-examine his life. Carmela isn't paying attention and sees a bag on the counter thinking that Meadow bought something with her credit card. Father Intintola states that it is his purchase and he says he bought the movie, One True Thing. He says he bought it so they could watch it and she could take her mind off of the stressors. The two drink their wine and Carmela asks Father Intintola if he's staying for dinner. Father Intintola knows something is wrong and asks Carmela if she needs to tell him something. Carmela says she wants to know so she can figure out how many steaks to defrost since Tony won't be home. Father Intintola tries to tell Carmela his concern is for Tony. Carmela tells Father Intintola that they both know that Tony doesn't care about examining his life. Father Intintola states that is the big reason why they need to talk to him. Carmela states that Tony is a sinner and Father Intintola comes into his home, eats his steaks, and uses the television and entertainment center. Father Intintola states that the DVD is for her. Carmela notes that last week she told him that she didn't like Renee Zellweger. Father Intintola admits he doesn't remember hearing that. Carmela states that if Father Intintola wants to watch One True Thing, then he can at least admit his true intentions. Carmela knows he only does this for the women to get gifts and great meals. Father Intintola is insulted by this, but Carmela states that she also feels he likes the whiff of sexuality that he feels but can't act on. Father Intintola notes he did admit that he had feelings for her, but that he has been dealing with them so he can continue to pastoral duties. Carmela asks Father Intintola how Rosalie fits into this equation. Father Intintola realizes why Carmela feels the way she does. Carmela tells Father Intintola she appreciates his religious counseling and their chats and she is fond of him, but she thinks he needs to evaluate himself. She thinks he has a goal of manipulating women in need of spiritual guidance. Father Intintola is left speechless and he leaves the home. At the nursing unit, Tony grabs a pillow off of a gurney and starts to walk down the hall. A nurse stops him and tells him that she is glad Carmela found him. Tony is confused and asks what she is talking about. The nurse is aware that nobody informed him yet of the situation. The nurse tells Tony that Livia has had a stroke. She tells Tony that the news of Junior's arrest upset Livia and the EMTs have just stabilized her for the ride to St. Vincent's Hospital. Tony spots the EMTs taking Livia out. Tony stops them and gets down to Livia's level. He tells her that he knows what she did and he can't believe she would do this to him. The EMT tells Tony that her speech has been affected by the stroke and Livia can't answer him. Tony disregards this. He tells Livia that he heard the FBI tapes and she knows what she tried to do. The EMT again tries to get Tony away from Livia, but Tony orders him not to get in the way. Tony tells Livia that Junior is in jail now and he is now on top. He tells Livia that he doesn't die easy and he will live a long, happy life unlike Livia's state. Security tries to take Tony away, but he is able to get free from them. Tony yells that he tried to be there for her and she tried to have him killed. He starts to get very angry when he sees what he thinks to be a smile on Livia's face. The nurse tries to tell Tony that Livia doesn't understand anything right now, but Tony is too angry. Livia is led out and Tony is also taken out by hospital security. Later, Tony drives around the city trying to take everything in. He stops at Dr. Melfi's office. When he walks in, a janitor is cleaning her office. He tells Tony that she went on vacation. The power suddenly goes off in the office. Tony realizes that Dr. Melfi took his advice and left town. He hopes that she is safe. Tony, Carmela, Meadow, and AJ are later driving in the storm. Meadow tells Tony that he should pull over because they aren't going to make it to Aunt Patty's house. Tony replies that there's a reason he bought the SUV so they could get through the rain. Carmela states that Meadow is right and states that she can barely see the road in front of them. Tony realizes they are on Walnut Parkway and states he has an idea. The SUV pulls over and everyone grabs umbrellas. They knock on the doors to Nuovo Vesuvio and Artie opens the doors. Carmela tells Artie that they picked up the kids at school, but they can't get home because a tree is down on their street. Tony states they've been on the road since seven o'clock and everyone is hungry. Artie states that he has no power and he's closing when the last customers leave. Meadow tells Tony that McDonald's will be opened for sure. Artie doesn't want to disappoint them and tells them to come inside. Paulie and Silvio are inside taking cover from the rain. Paulie has some cream on his face and hands to stop the itching from the poison ivy. Tony greets them. Adriana and Christopher are also inside eating. Charmaine tells Meadow and AJ that Chiara and her siblings are in the kitchen playing games if they want to go back and see them. The two head to the back. Artie tells Tony that they've been cooking by candlelight and says he can make them certain things. Tony asks for whatever he has prepared. At their table, Silvio notices the young love that Adriana and Christopher have for each other. Paulie asks Silvio how he really feels about Tony seeing a psychiatrist. Silvio tells Paulie he's fine with it, and suggests to Paulie that he learn to sit right with it as well. Silvio doesn't understand why Paulie is bothered when he admitted to also seeing a psychiatrist. Paulie says he just can't get past the fact Tony is seeing a female psychiatrist. Silvio notes that Paulie is the one with women issues and says he doesn't want to go there with him. Paulie says that he has said is piece. Silvio asks Paulie what he's really trying to say. Paulie says he isn't getting at any point. Silvio notes to Paulie that Tony is going to be the new boss of the family and they need to wish him the best of luck. Paulie agrees. Artie brings Tony and Carmela their food. Meadow and A.J. come back out to join them. The family thanks Artie for the great service. Before the family eats, Tony tells them that he wants to propose a toast. He says that someday soon, Meadow and A.J. will have families of their own. He says that if they're lucky they will remember the little moments like this that were good. He toasts to all of them and they drink to their good health. The episode ends with the family eating together at the table.

description: Stabler and Benson investigate the murder and castration of a New York cab driver. They discover that the victim had assumed the identity of another man because he himself was wanted by police.
tags: ['police', 'gay character', 'sex with a dead body', 'penis cut off', 'suicide by stabbing', '4 year old boy', 'gay flirting', 'flirting', 'castration', 'rape', 'detective partner', 'assistant district attorney', 'suicide', 'victim fights back', 'vomiting', 'survivor', 'autopsy', 'reference to baltimore', 'conspiracy theory', 'bisexual', 'gay prostitute', 'gay man flirts with straight man', 'gay prisoner', 'prison', 'fake identification', 'flashing', "exposing one's penis", 'coroner', 'detective', 'torture', 'trauma', 'mother daughter relationship', 'revenge', 'taxi driver', 'war criminal', 'identity theft']
synopsis_with_character_names: The grisly murder and dismemberment of a New York cabbie draws the elite Special Victims Unit of the NYPD, including veteran Detective Elliot Stabler and his partner, Olivia Benson, who soon discover that the victim had assumed the identity of another man, mainly because he himself was a wanted man. The victim was a war criminal who brutally raped and tortured women who had been under his control. As Benson finds out more about the victim, she begins to have doubts about whether she wants to pursue the women who are the primary suspects, all of whom were brutalized by the cabbie. Benson even discusses her indecision with her mother (played by Elizabeth Ashley), comparing it to her own feelings about her mother's rape. Stabler and Benson are in conflict with each other, as Stabler has reservations about Benson's dedication to making sure the investigation is thorough. The meaning of "justice" is dissected and resolved.

description: A probable suicide becomes a murder investigation with suspects that include the writer's psychiatrist, a family member and a local news anchor, but the woman's sister brings evidence that will turn the case on its head.
tags: ['ptsd post traumatic stress disorder', 'police', 'suicide', 'rape', 'child abuse', 'fake identity', 'loneliness', 'depression', 'traumatic childhood', 'father daughter relationship', 'sister sister relationship', 'reference to sylvia plath', 'roof', 'infidelity', 'reporter', 'sex with therapist', 'sex addict', 'father daughter incest', 'incest']
synopsis_with_character_names: When the body of Gretchen Quinn is found wearing only a red slip after having gone through an upper-story window, Benson and Stabler soon find out that 'Gretchen Quinn' has never existed. While trying to piece together her life, the detectives are led to Gretchen's psychiatrist and a well-known television newscaster, both of whom were sleeping with her, and through an overdue library book finally trace Gretchen back to a young woman who changed her name and identity after graduating high school to get away from her sexually abusive father. Cragen and Benson find it easy to identify with the young woman, as they both have ghosts of their own from which they must escape. Detectives manage to contact the victim's sister, who experienced the same trauma growing up.

description: The squad investigates a serial rapist targeting women on subways. Meanwhile, Benson begins dating an ambitious crime reporter.
tags: ['police']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The episode opens with a woman - Jen Caulder (Nicole Sullivan) wearing a skirt, talking on the cell phone. After she enters a subway train, she is pinned down against the wall of the subway car and raped. The SVU team gets involved and it is soon revealed that seven young women, in a six-month time span, have been raped by a flash-and-dash assailant on the City subways. Interviewing witnesses on the train results in no substantial leads, except that the preps pants were dirty and had splatters of paint on them.

The brass calls in a psychiatrist - Dr Audrey Jackson (Audra McDonald) to help the team get into the head of the prep. A man - Bruce Bohne is apprehended in the subway train after he allegedly attacks another woman. He is arrested but he claims that the train jerked and made him fall on the woman and all this is a mistake. The 7 victims are asked to identify the prep from a lineup and they all fail to identify the perp. SVU decides to indite him on a lesser charge of fondling. Dr Jackson interviews the suspect and suggests that Bruce is NOT the subway rapist and SVU lets him go.

After another rape on the subway occurs, Jeffries and Munch find a parking ticket. When they follow up on the lead, the perp is found at a construction site. Although Jen Caulder positively identifies her rapist the case is dismissed on a technicality as all the victims spoke to each other while waiting for their turn to identify the perp from the line up.

SVU then follows up on driver's license of a woman found in the perps wallet, who could put him away.

description: An investigative reporter bravely airs a piece about her own rape that occurred 2 months earlier. Her description of the men that attacked her results in fresh leads and unexpected turns of events along the way.
tags: ['police', 'bare chested male bondage']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Sarah Logan, a field reporter on the news, tells her audience of being raped. She tells them the police have been working her case for 12 weeks with no leads. She asks for their help. She describes one as having a tattoo of a star on his wrists and smelling like cigarettes and the other wore a running suit. She tells her audience she is going to fight back.

A woman watching the news realizes the guy she is with could be one of them, but when she tries to call the police, he stops her. When she does talk to Benson and Stabler, she tells them he is Mark Krieger, a car parts sales rep from Cleveland. She gives them the key to her room. When they go in, he is puking in the toilet. As Benson attempts to read him his rights, he tells her the city will have to pay for his lawyer because he is broke before he pukes again causing Benson to excuse herself.

Stabler tells the team Krieger works in construction and has priors including possession, assaults stemming mostly from bar fights, and kiting checks. Benson tells them he is from Queens, but he told his date different. Stabler informs them the girl knows she was almost the next victim of Mr. Goodbar. Benson tells them he lawyered up immediately. After Munch tells them he always thought it was a crime of opportunity, Jeffries tells them the perps did not even know who Sarah was. Cragen informs them they may end up having to file against Krieger and "an un-apprehended other," but he wants to find the other guy before Krieger gives him a heads up. Cragen tells them to check phone records, employment records, credit card bills, and find the other guy. When the meeting breaks up, Munch asks Cragen if anyone notified Sarah about the suspect. He tells him he thought he should tell her himself.

When Munch goes to tell Sarah about the arrest, she asks if he saw her piece on the news. He tells her it took guts to do that. She asks him to tell her the guy's name, but he reminds her it would jeopardize the line-up. He assures her he will tell her everything when it is over. He informs her she probably will not see the guy again until court.

While Munch and Jeffries search Krieger's apartment, Jeffries guesses he only works as often as he has to. Munch tears part of a poster containing phone numbers. They figure his ashtray collection is from his one-night stands so they take them. They realize the second rapist could be one of opportunity.

In the squad room, Cragen interrupts Benson and Stabler as they look at the bars advertised on the ashtrays. He reminds them of his drinking days. Benson asks him which one is closest to the attack. He responds with Shad's Cabaret adding it is just a bunch of hard working locals and confused out-of-towners. He asks that they let him know if anything has changed. While Munch tells them he came up empty on his calls, Jeffries tells him she found one that knows Krieger.

When Jeffries and Munch talk with Krieger's cousin, P.K., he informs them he has not seen him since Labor Day. He tells them Krieger is always getting into trouble.

Stabler finds Krieger owes Shad's Cabaret $36, but he used his credit card. When the owner cannot tell him what Krieger bought, Stabler explains the drinks would tell him if he was drinking alone or with someone. The owner tells him the only information on the receipt is the date of January 11th.

Sarah walks into the line-up and is introduced to everyone. Cragen explains the men will not be able to see her. Munch adds if she does not recognize anyone she needs to make sure before saying so. At her request, Cragen asks the men to roll up their sleeves and turn their wrists out. When all of them have the tattoo, she gets a little confused, but points out number three.

As Munch escorts her from the line-up, he tells her the man's name is Mark Krieger and he is a welder from Queens. After he tells her they interrogated Krieger but he did not talk, she asks him if they can make a deal with him to give up the other rapist. He reminds her his lawyer will not let them talk to him. When she tells him she wants to know why the chose her, he tells her rapists give excuses they hear on television and in movies to judges and journalists after they are convicted. The truth is she will never know why they chose her and they may never catch the second guy.

Cragen informs the team he has received three calls in two days from One Police Plaza inquiring as to where they are on Sarah's case. Munch informs him they have DNA, a witness placing him in the neighborhood, and Sarah. Cragen reminds them they still do not have the second guy and it has been almost a month. Stabler informs him they have checked employers, landlords, and every bar he ever stole an ashtray at and got nothing. Benson informs him Krieger did not keep friends any longer than he needed them. When Cragen asks if they have any long shots, Stabler tells him he received a call from an informant in Rikers saying he heard something from someone.

At Rikers, Stabler tells his informant he was able to get his daughter's teacher to cut her some slack and do summer school and he has the principal looking out for her. His informant tells him Krieger is scared he is going down on this one, but he did not know who Sarah was when he did it. When asked about the second guy, the only thing he knows is the guy was already in Rikers on a DUI charge or something like that. When Krieger found him he told him to keep quiet or he will kill him. Stabler asks a jail administrator for a list of everyone in the day Krieger came in. She tells him that would be 16,000 names. He asks her to rule out women and children and narrows it to 12,000 men. When she asks him what he actually needs, he tells her he needs everyone who came into contact with Krieger narrowing it to 6,204 possibilities. After he is denied his request to narrow it down by age and race, she hands him a disk.

ADA Alden explains to Munch that Defense Attorney Sorenson will try to rush the case to trial in order to catch them unprepared. When Munch tells her they are ready, she reminds him Sarah says she was raped by two men, but they will only be able to show the jury one. Sarah took an unusual route home so he will try to say it was more than a leisurely walk home. She reminds him they do not have semen, but he reminds her a condom was used. She does not believe Sarah is ready so she suggests he ask for Benson's help in prepping Sarah.

Benson tells Sarah the defense cannot bring up her sexual history on the stand, but they may be able to allude to it. She informs her the defense does not have to prove it did not happen as long as they can muddy the waters a little. Munch tells her they will try to beat her up on the stand. They explain she will have to be detailed explaining where each person was, each body part, and explain how she could tell which guy it was. Benson tells her to answer with simple and direct answers. She tells her to use the actual names for body parts and if they make her uncomfortable talk to her or Munch until she is comfortable.

In court, the defense files 4 motions, including one to exclude the witness identification, and the prosecution files one to exclude press from the courtroom. The judge states he will rule in the morning. In the hallway, Sarah questions why they are trying to exclude her identification. ADA Alden explains their only hope is to try to convince the judge and jury that everyone from the police to the witness is incompetent. Sarah responds by asking Munch to come on her show stating it has already been cleared with Cragen. Munch tries to talk his way out of it saying a woman is who she needs to have if the subject is rape. She tells him that if her audience sees him, they will be more likely to go to the police. After she bribes him with dinner after the show, he reminds her not to say the word "bribe" to a cop in a crowded courthouse.

While Munch is waiting at the studio for Sarah, he is told there is some gridlock by her neighborhood. When he receives a call, he leaves to go to her apartment. When he arrives, a firefighter tries to stop him from going in citing the building is not safe. When he makes his way past the firefighter, Benson stops him letting him know it was Sarah. She tells him the neighbors heard a single blast. The bomb squad got the call at 6:46 and arrived at 6:52. She informs him the six minutes would not have mattered. When Munch gets to her apartment, he is told it was a black powder bomb in a box of flowers. She saw the flowers at her door and brought them in. When she opened them, she blocked the blast from the north side of the room with her body killing her instantly.

When Munch arrives at work, he tells Jefferies he stayed at the scene late and Benson is still there canvassing. Cragen slowly makes his way to his three remaining detectives and asks for an update. Stabler informs them his source told him the second guy was in Rikers when they got Krieger. He narrowed the field of possibilities by age and description before narrowing it further to those who were out when the rape occurred leaving 207 men. When Munch clarifies they are going on the assumption the second guy is the bomber, he then reminds them Sarah's testimony is out unless they suggest Krieger masterminded the bombing. Stabler adds Krieger could not mastermind a church picnic. Cragen tells Munch and Jeffries to work on the rape, and tells Stabler to work on the bombing with Benson and only share information with Munch about Krieger. Cragen requests Munch's presence in his office to see if he needs time off which he declines.

Benson and Stabler are informed the bomb was made from a soup can, Chinese black powder, and a flammable liquid held together with masking tape wired to a remote. Benson explains the guy used a bomb instead of a gun, put it in a romantic box of flowers, and used a remote instead of a switch. Stabler picks up on where she is going realizing the guy had her life in his hands. When he asks if the park across the street from her apartment was searched, he is told they did not know to look there. He suggests the guy wanted to watch her die.

While looking at the park, Stabler picks up a wrapper from a pile of throat lozenge wrappers thinking the guy may have had a cold. Benson notes the guy would have been able to see right into her apartment. The guy had to buy the supplies, make the bomb, deliver it, and kill her. They realize the perps each have their own motive and MO. One is a planner and Krieger joins in at the last minute. They realize Krieger went along just for the ride.

In court, Sorenson asks the judge to quash the indictment since Sarah is dead. ADA Alden asks they allow her journals and statements to the police in under Geraci. The judge tells her they have seven days to link Krieger to the bombing or the indictment will be quashed. After Sorenson asks for his client to let out so he can help with his defense, the judge sets bail at $50,000. Munch expresses his disdain for the decision and is fined for contempt. He only stops when the judge threatens to put him in lock-up with the next word. Jefferies ushers Munch out of the courtroom citing a call she received from Krieger's cousin.

P.K. tells Munch and Jefferies he remembers a friend of Krieger's from selling pot named Tommy. He adds his last name is something Irish. When he asks if he will get the reward, Munch throws some money at him telling him to go buy himself a blunt.

After locating 18 men fitting their requirements, Munch and Jefferies try Shad's Cabaret to see if he was there drinking with Krieger. After seeing a picture of Krieger and a photo array, the owner picks out Tommy McConagh

While Jeffries acts like she is trying to pump gas unsuccessfully, Munch approaches the window complaining his wife cannot get gas and he has to be at work. When McConagh heads for the door, Benson, Stabler, and Munch meet him there with guns out to arrest him.

Stabler explains to McConagh in the interrogation room that he knows about the pot bust, but does not care about that. He reminds him he was in jail for a week when Krieger approaches him and tells him not to talk about the night they went partying at Shad's. He informs him that he will be the one going down for murder since Krieger is pinning it all on him unless he tells his story. McConagh tells him they were high and he dares Krieger to pick the lock to the swimming pool. Krieger tells him it would be a good lace to do a girl. He attacks Sarah, but he did not watch. Stabler remind him he is Irish and was raised to respect women. McConagh admits to watching the rape. In the viewing room, Jeffries comments that Krieger's bail has been revoked. Munch tells her "Let's go."

At Krieger's apartment, Krieger takes off running when he hears Munch and Jefferies. Krieger gets into a van and just before Jefferies gets to him, the van explodes knocking her down. Munch moves Jefferies to safety telling her he will call Cragen.

Munch, Benson, and Stabler are told the bomb was the same as the one in Sarah's apartment. After they are told the guy could have been 50 feet away, they check on Jeffries. When Munch asks her to take a few days, she agrees.

Stabler informs the team that the canvas is coming up empty. They discuss it may be a case where the guy thought he had a relationship with her and did not believe she should be talking about her rape on television. Cragen tells them to look through her correspondence after her story aired. Stabler tells Cragen McConagh flipped on Krieger, but admitted nothing himself. After reminding him McConagh does not know Krieger died, Cragen decides to play the disappointed father figure.

After Cragen tells McConagh he knows he lied to Stabler, he asks what happened that night. McConagh tells him he held Sarah down while Krieger raped her. She asked them not to hurt her. He admits he raped her next using a condom. When she is still crying her asks her what more does she want since he used the condom.

While they are searching Sarah's mail, Munch brings up the powder used in making the bombs. Benson realizes they can test for the powder residue so they all drop the mail and take it to the lab. They find a card in a red envelope. After Munch notices they did not sign it, they spray for fingerprints.

After running the prints through the criminal databases and city employees, they come up empty. Cragen tells them to run the prints through the weeds of prospective employees. They come up with Wlliam Lexner. He graduated from Queens College in 1984 and was rejected from the Fire Department six times with the most recent time being in '99. Munch reads from the psych report that he is narcissistic and thinks he has enemies preventing him from being hired by the Fire Department. Cragen tells them he wants to try to take him without incident, but plans to take the bomb squad as a precaution.

After evacuating the rest of the building, Munch and Stabler are asked if they want suits. When Munch tells him he is wearing one, they are told bomb suits only make them better looking corpses making Stabler more nervous. Stabler knocks on the door claiming to have a certified check for him saying he needs a signature and it will take 6 to 8 weeks for re-delivery. Stabler then pretends to leave, tricking Lexner into opening the door. Munch pulls his gun while Stabler overpowers him.

Cragen tells Munch they will not be able to make the case on forensics alone. They need a confession. When Munch introduces himself to Lexner, he recognizes him as the cop who handled Sarah's case. Munch tells him he is more interesting than the rape cases he handles every day. Lexner tells him rape is the worst crime of all because guys will be with the women who have not been raped before the ones who have. Munch tells him it should not matter if you care. Munch concludes Lexner saw Sarah differently after the rape. He confirms this stating she never smiled the same. Munch tells him she was a good woman who did good deeds. Lexner asks what she was like, noting Sarah mentioned Munch twice saying they clicked. Lexner tells him he wanted Sarah to be happy like she once was. He ordered the flowers she would have wanted and wrapped the box in a gold ribbon like she would have wanted and left it in front of her building. He was in the park and watched the 5:00 news. He watched her take the box to her apartment and watched for her smile before he flipped the switch.

description: The trial of an accused child molester is jeopardized when the prime witness has difficulty dealing with his past.
tags: ['police']
synopsis_with_character_names: Benson and Stabler are called into a pharmacy in a run-down neighbor hood when the employee at the one-hour photo develops disturbing pictures. The pedophalic pictures belong to Larry Holt, a piano insturctor who lives in the area. An investigation starts that leads to the discovery that Holt has been abusing children sexually during his piano lessons, and has been secretly video-taping the lessons for the past thirteen years. A little boy is shown on several of the tapes as he progresses in age. It is discovered that the boy is named Evan. He initially denies any abuse, until he is shown his video tapes. After a breakdown, he refuses to testify against his piano teacher citing him as a good man who did many positive things for him. As he comes to terms with the importance of his role in the case, he agrees to testify. Upon a review of the tapes, however, we come to find that Evan has also abused children while giving them piano lessons. Evan goes on to testify against Mr. Holt and provides damning testimony. Holt is sentenced to 115 years in prison; the maximum sentence. After the father of Evan's victim threatens to get the media involved in the case, the detectives try to find a way around a maximum sentence. Evan says that he is not like Mr. Holt and accepts his maximum jail term.

description: An attorney (guest star Andrew McCarthy) suspected of keeping a Romanian immigrant as a sex slave is linked to a woman's murder.
tags: ['police', 'doctor', 'drug addicted doctor', 'adopted child', 'adopted daughter', 'veterinarian', 'torture', 'kidnapping', 'nanny', 's&m', 'bdsm', 'bondage']
synopsis_with_character_names:
After a shopkeeper is handed an address and told to tell the woman living there something is very bad and "she was right." He brings a note for help to the squad, which leads the detectives to the written address, whose resident claims she does not know the source of the plea. However, when asked the whereabouts of her niece, she states her niece, Ilena (3 years from RomaniaI) is fine.

The detectives have just begun to track Ilena when her aunt is found dead beside the highway, having been killed less than an hour after she had been visited by Stabler and Benson. Urged on by a sense of dread, they locate Ilena, who denies anything is wrong. She is working as a live-in maid to a yuppie wealthy couple. However, dissonance is felt when they interview the husband and he vocally abuses his assistant in front of them and tries to demand where Benson should sit.

They finally are able to tie the wife to the death of the aunt, and her fear and servility to her husband leads them to pounce harder on him. However, missing is the young Romanian Ilena. A desperate house search locates the girl, but the stunning manner in which she is hid must be seen.

A secondary thread is that One Police center has ordered the squad to participate in an experimental series of psych evaluations. We see each of the characters answer one or two questions, with Munch getting the longest screen time here.

At the end, the psychologist informs Cragen that one of the officers must be terminated " immediately." Identification is kept from us by the final fade-out.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Lip overhears Monica and Roberta plotting in the bathroom....DNA results are coming back soon to prove Liam is not Frank's kid and they'll be able to take him no matter what.

Fiona and Steve are in the new house with a baby monitor to communicate back to the house with all the other kids.

Next morning, Monica is trying to fill in as Fiona. She can't seem to handle the struggle of all the motherly details. Roberta is just barking orders from the table. Fiona is listening to the racket from the window in the next door house and gets irate about how poor of a mother Monica is/was. Steve gives Fiona a cell phone and money for her to go out and buy them a couch.

Roberta tells the kids she and Monica won't be there when they get home from school. Lip stays behind to confront Monica and Roberta about the DNA test. He says there is no way that they're taking Liam and starts to get into it with Roberta. He storms out after Monica stops the confrontation and she runs after him, begging forgiveness. He doesn't fall for her tears (thankfully).

Karen has agreed to go to the Purity Ball so her dad will give her the car. Frank and Shiela argue about Monica. She's jealous and he's....well, he's Frank. He leaves and there's a car following him down the street.

Roberta and Monica are talking in the kitchen between themselves about leaving the next day. Monica is saying how she wants to stay though and finally be a mom. Roberta talks "sense" into her and convinces her that leaving after the DNA results come back is the right thing to do. Frank comes in....Roberta tells him he gets no money unless he convinces the kids to get on board with them taking Liam. They threaten him with claiming spousal support, etc...He goes next door to break into Steve and Fiona's house.

V and Fi move a couch into the house and find Frank having broken in, drinking in her kitchen. He screams at her telling her the kids are none of her business - basically he's just interested in the money. He leaves; goes down to Alibi (the bar).

Fiona and V are looking up attorneys dealing with children's rights or adoption, etc. Lip and Ian are sitting in a car watching movement of Roberta and Monica, chatting. Ian explains to Lip that Mickey is gay and they're fooling around on the DL, Cash's wife found out about Ian and Cash and forced him to knock her up again and Mickey is in juve rather than admit he's gay.

DNA results show that Frank is Liam's father....hence, Nana Gallagher had an affair and the genes are actually Frank's to pass on and Monica is still his mother. But Roberta is on a rampage and says they're still gonna get Frank to sign over his parental rights and they leave.

Frank starts messing with the guy in the car who's following him and recording him. Its someone from the insurance company and they're trying to catch him from lying and getting more money from them. He's sitting at home when Carl comes in having hurt himself from a bike trick gone wrong. Frank gets an insurance scam idea and finally is interested in Carl's situation.

Lip and Ian take DNA swabs of their own, hoping to find they aren't Frank's kids.

Frank and Carl stage an accident to make it look like the insurance follower hits Carl on his bike. He actually does and Carl smiles real big knowing he's got another scam going.

Karen is home getting ready for the Purity Ball and Shiela invites Karen's dad to stay for dinner before they leave. Frank is at home with his "wife". They take come pictures after and Karen actually looks happy and interested.

Ian goes to juve to talk with Mickey through the glass. Steve gets pulled by Tony the cop. Awkward moment....Tony congratulates Steve on the new house. Steve tries to make small talk. Tony sends a message, basically, to take care of Fiona or else.

Fiona, Lip and Debs confront Frank at Alibi and tell him not to sign anything from Monica regarding his parental rights. Lip punches him and they leave.

At the Purity Ball, girls are confessing their "sins of the flesh" in round robin fashion. Also in round robin fashion, all the kids are sitting back at the family home passing a doobie and contemplating the benefits of not actually being Frank's kids. Back at the Purity Ball, its Karen's turn to share her sins and she goes into so much detail or guy and girl "interaction" that her father stands up and calls her a whore!!

Lip and Ian's DNA results come back....and good news for Ian - not Franks. Frank is only a bit concerned that Ian isn't his, but its likely that Ian is the child of one of Frank's brothers. Of course, with Monica. A family argument ensues with a bunch of semantics about who left who versus who drove who out, etc etc. Fiona aptly ends the discussion by telling her to get the heck out of dodge - with Bob, without Liam.

Karen comes crying and screaming back home and goes to the cellar to bash in her father's things. Shiela tells him to get out and pushes him outside.....yeah...she goes outside. Where Frank sees her and tells her she's out of the house. She freaks out in a good way and starts waving at the train going by.

The kids are all at Steve's place watching the family house. They see Monica and Bob come out to leave and Monica is carrying Liam. She walks over to the kids and starts to cry. She kisses Liam and hands him to Fiona before retreating to leave for one last time with Roberta. Once again, Fiona is back in charge.
